060/**
061 * Provides different utilities methods to apply processing from a security perspective.<br>
062 * These code snippet:
063 * <ul>
064 *     <li>Can be used, as "foundation", to customize the validation to the app context.</li>
065 *     <li>Were implemented in a way to facilitate adding or removal of validations depending on usage context.</li>
066 *     <li>Were centralized on one class to be able to enhance them across time as well as <a href="https://github.com/righettod/code-snippets-security-utils/issues">missing case/bug identification</a>.</li>
067 * </ul>
068 */
069public class SecurityUtils {
070
071    /**
072     * Default constructor: Not needed as the class only provides static methods.
073     */
074    private SecurityUtils() {
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Apply a collection of validation to verify if a provided PIN code is considered weak (easy to guess) or none.<br>
079     * This method consider that format of the PIN code is [0-9]{6,}<br>
080     * Rule to consider a PIN code as weak:<br>
081     * - Length is inferior to 6 positions.<br>
082     * - Contain only the same number or only a sequence of zero.<br>
083     * - Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers.<br>
084     *
085     * @param pinCode PIN code to verify.
086     * @return True only if the PIN is considered as weak.
087     */
088    public static boolean isWeakPINCode(String pinCode) {
089        boolean isWeak = true;
090        //Length is inferior to 6 positions
091        //Use "Long.parseLong(pinCode)" to cause a NumberFormatException if the PIN is not a numeric one
092        //and to ensure that the PIN is not only a sequence of zero
093        if (pinCode != null && Long.parseLong(pinCode) > 0 && pinCode.trim().length() > 5) {
094            //Contain only the same number
095            String regex = String.format("^[%s]{%s}$", pinCode.charAt(0), pinCode.length());
096            if (!Pattern.matches(regex, pinCode)) {
097                //Contain sequence of following incremental or decremental numbers
098                char previousChar = 'X';
099                boolean containSequence = false;
100                for (char c : pinCode.toCharArray()) {
101                    if (previousChar != 'X') {
102                        int previousNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(previousChar));
103                        int currentNbr = Integer.parseInt(String.valueOf(c));
104                        if (currentNbr == (previousNbr - 1) || currentNbr == (previousNbr + 1)) {
105                            containSequence = true;
106                            break;
107                        }
108                    }
109                    previousChar = c;
110                }
111                if (!containSequence) {
112                    isWeak = false;
113                }
114            }
115        }
116        return isWeak;
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Apply a collection of validations on a Word 97-2003 (binary format) document file provided:<br>
121     * - Real Microsoft Word 97-2003 document file.<br>
122     * - No VBA Macro.<br>
123     * - No embedded objects.<br>
124     *
125     * @param wordFilePath Filename of the Word document file to check.
126     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
127     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/"
128     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/document/"
129     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/how-to.html"
130     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/components/poifs/embeded.html"
131     * @see "https://poi.apache.org/"
132     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.poi/poi"
133     */
134    public static boolean isWord972003DocumentSafe(String wordFilePath) {
135        boolean isSafe = false;
136        try {
137            File wordFile = new File(wordFilePath);
138            if (wordFile.exists() && wordFile.canRead() && wordFile.isFile()) {
139                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid Word 97-2003 format file
140                try (POIFSFileSystem fs = new POIFSFileSystem(wordFile)) {
141                    //Step 2: Check if the document contains VBA macros, in our case is not allowed
142                    VBAMacroReader macroReader = new VBAMacroReader(fs);
143                    Map<String, String> macros = macroReader.readMacros();
144                    if (macros == null || macros.isEmpty()) {
145                        //Step 3: Check if the document contains any embedded objects, in our case is not allowed
146                        //From POI documentation:
147                        //Word normally stores embedded files in subdirectories of the ObjectPool directory, itself a subdirectory of the filesystem root.
148                        //Typically, these subdirectories and named starting with an underscore, followed by 10 numbers.
149                        final List<String> embeddedObjectFound = new ArrayList<>();
150                        DirectoryEntry root = fs.getRoot();
151                        if (root.getEntryCount() > 0) {
152                            root.iterator().forEachRemaining(entry -> {
153                                if ("ObjectPool".equalsIgnoreCase(entry.getName()) && entry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
154                                    DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectory = (DirectoryEntry) entry;
155                                    if (objPoolDirectory.getEntryCount() > 0) {
156                                        objPoolDirectory.iterator().forEachRemaining(objPoolDirectoryEntry -> {
157                                            if (objPoolDirectoryEntry instanceof DirectoryEntry) {
158                                                DirectoryEntry objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry = (DirectoryEntry) objPoolDirectoryEntry;
159                                                if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.getEntryCount() > 0) {
160                                                    objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntry.forEach(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry -> {
161                                                        if (objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.isDocumentEntry()) {
162                                                            embeddedObjectFound.add(objPoolDirectoryEntrySubDirectoryEntryEntry.getName());
163                                                        }
164                                                    });
165                                                }
166                                            }
167                                        });
168                                    }
169                                }
170                            });
171                        }
172                        isSafe = embeddedObjectFound.isEmpty();
173                    }
174                }
175            }
176        } catch (Exception e) {
177            isSafe = false;
178        }
179        return isSafe;
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Ensure that an XML file does not contain any External Entity, DTD or XInclude instructions.
184     *
185     * @param xmlFilePath Filename of the XML file to check.
186     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
187     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/xxe"
188     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html#java"
189     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/13/security/java-api-xml-processing-jaxp-security-guide.html#GUID-82F8C206-F2DF-4204-9544-F96155B1D258"
190     * @see "https://www.w3.org/TR/xinclude-11/"
191     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XInclude"
192     */
193    public static boolean isXMLSafe(String xmlFilePath) {
194        boolean isSafe = false;
195        try {
196            File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
197            if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
198                //Step 1a: Verify that the XML file content does not contain any XInclude instructions
199                boolean containXInclude = Files.readAllLines(xmlFile.toPath()).stream().anyMatch(line -> line.toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).contains(":include "));
200                if (!containXInclude) {
201                    //Step 1b: Parse the XML file, if an exception occur than it's imply that the XML specified is not a valid ones
202                    //Create an XML document builder throwing Exception if a DOCTYPE instruction is present
203                    DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
204                    dbfInstance.setFeature("http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl", true);
205                    //Xerces 2 only
206                    //dbfInstance.setFeature("http://xerces.apache.org/xerces2-j/features.html#disallow-doctype-decl",true);
207                    dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
208                    DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
209                    //Parse the document
210                    Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
211                    isSafe = (doc != null && doc.getDocumentElement() != null);
212                }
213            }
214        } catch (Exception e) {
215            isSafe = false;
216        }
217        return isSafe;
218    }
219
220
221    /**
222     * Extract all URL links from a PDF file provided.<br>
223     * This can be used to apply validation on a PDF against contained links.
224     *
225     * @param pdfFilePath pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to process.
226     * @return A List of URL objects that is empty if no links is found.
227     * @throws Exception If any error occurs during the processing of the PDF file.
228     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
229     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
230     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
231     */
232    public static List<URL> extractAllPDFLinks(String pdfFilePath) throws Exception {
233        final List<URL> links = new ArrayList<>();
234        File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
235        try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
236            PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
237            AnnotationFilter actionURIAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
238                @Override
239                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
240                    boolean keep = false;
241                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
242                        keep = (((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction() instanceof PDActionURI);
243                    }
244                    return keep;
245                }
246            };
247            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
248                try {
249                    page.getAnnotations(actionURIAnnotationFilter).forEach(annotation -> {
250                        PDActionURI linkAnnotation = (PDActionURI) ((PDAnnotationLink) annotation).getAction();
251                        try {
252                            URL urlObj = new URL(linkAnnotation.getURI());
253                            if (!links.contains(urlObj)) {
254                                links.add(urlObj);
255                            }
256                        } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
257                            throw new RuntimeException(e);
258                        }
259                    });
260                } catch (Exception e) {
261                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
262                }
263            });
264        }
265        return links;
266    }
267
268    /**
269     * Apply a collection of validations on a PDF file provided:<br>
270     * - Real PDF file<br>
271     * - No attachments.<br>
272     * - No Javascript code.<br>
273     * - No links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData.<br>
274     *
275     * @param pdfFilePath Filename of the PDF file to check.
276     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
277     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/36161267"
278     * @see "https://www.gushiciku.cn/pl/21KQ"
279     * @see "https://github.com/jonaslejon/malicious-pdf"
280     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
281     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
282     */
283    public static boolean isPDFSafe(String pdfFilePath) {
284        boolean isSafe = false;
285        try {
286            File pdfFile = new File(pdfFilePath);
287            if (pdfFile.exists() && pdfFile.canRead() && pdfFile.isFile()) {
288                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid PDF file
289                try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(pdfFile)) {
290                    //Step 2: Check if the file contains attached files, in our case is not allowed
291                    PDDocumentCatalog documentCatalog = document.getDocumentCatalog();
292                    PDDocumentNameDictionary namesDictionary = new PDDocumentNameDictionary(documentCatalog);
293                    if (namesDictionary.getEmbeddedFiles() == null) {
294                        //Step 3: Check if the file contains Javascript code, in our case is not allowed
295                        if (namesDictionary.getJavaScript() == null) {
296                            //Step 4: Check if the file contains links using action of type URI/Launch/RemoteGoTo/ImportData, in our case is not allowed
297                            final List<Integer> notAllowedAnnotationCounterList = new ArrayList<>();
298                            AnnotationFilter notAllowedAnnotationFilter = new AnnotationFilter() {
299                                @Override
300                                public boolean accept(PDAnnotation annotation) {
301                                    boolean keep = false;
302                                    if (annotation instanceof PDAnnotationLink) {
303                                        PDAnnotationLink link = (PDAnnotationLink) annotation;
304                                        PDAction action = link.getAction();
305                                        if ((action instanceof PDActionURI)
306                                                || (action instanceof PDActionLaunch)
307                                                || (action instanceof PDActionRemoteGoTo)
308                                                || (action instanceof PDActionImportData)
309                                        ) {
310                                            keep = true;
311                                        }
312                                    }
313                                    return keep;
314                                }
315                            };
316                            documentCatalog.getPages().forEach(page -> {
317                                try {
318                                    notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.add(page.getAnnotations(notAllowedAnnotationFilter).size());
319                                } catch (IOException e) {
320                                    throw new RuntimeException(e);
321                                }
322                            });
323                            if (notAllowedAnnotationCounterList.stream().reduce(0, Integer::sum) == 0) {
324                                isSafe = true;
325                            }
326                        }
327                    }
328                }
329            }
330        } catch (Exception e) {
331            isSafe = false;
332        }
333        return isSafe;
334    }
335
336    /**
337     * Remove as much as possible metadata from the provided PDF document object.
338     *
339     * @param document PDFBox PDF document object on which metadata must be removed.
340     * @see "https://gist.github.com/righettod/d7e07443c43d393a39de741a0d920069"
341     * @see "https://pdfbox.apache.org/"
342     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.pdfbox/pdfbox"
343     */
344    public static void clearPDFMetadata(PDDocument document) {
345        if (document != null) {
346            PDDocumentInformation infoEmpty = new PDDocumentInformation();
347            document.setDocumentInformation(infoEmpty);
348            PDMetadata newMetadataEmpty = new PDMetadata(document);
349            document.getDocumentCatalog().setMetadata(newMetadataEmpty);
350        }
351    }
352
353
354    /**
355     * Validate that the URL provided is really a relative URL.
356     *
357     * @param targetUrl URL to validate.
358     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
359     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/ssrf"
360     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/q/6785442"
361     */
362    public static boolean isRelativeURL(String targetUrl) {
363        boolean isValid = false;
364        //Reject any URL encoded content and URL starting with a double slash
365        //Reject any URL contains credentials or fragment to prevent potential bypasses
366        String work = targetUrl;
367        if (!work.contains("%") && !work.contains("@") && !work.contains("#") && !work.startsWith("//")) {
368            //Creation of a URL object must fail
369            try {
370                new URL(work);
371                isValid = false;
372            } catch (MalformedURLException mf) {
373                //Last check to be sure (for prod usage compile the pattern one time)
374                isValid = Pattern.compile("^/[a-z0-9]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE).matcher(work).find();
375            }
376        }
377        return isValid;
378    }
379
380    /**
381     * Apply a collection of validations on a ZIP file provided:<br>
382     * - Real ZIP file<br>
383     * - Contain less than a specified level of deepness.<br>
384     * - Do not contain Zip-Slip entry path.<br>
385     *
386     * @param zipFilePath       Filename of the ZIP file to check.
387     * @param maxLevelDeepness  Threshold of deepness above which a ZIP archive will be rejected.
388     * @param rejectArchiveFile Flag to specify if presence of any archive entry will cause the rejection of the ZIP file.
389     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
390     * @see "https://rules.sonarsource.com/java/type/Security%20Hotspot/RSPEC-5042"
391     * @see "https://security.snyk.io/research/zip-slip-vulnerability"
392     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zip_bomb"
393     * @see "https://github.com/ptoomey3/evilarc"
394     * @see "https://github.com/abdulfatir/ZipBomb"
395     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/cs/zip-bomb"
396     * @see "https://thesecurityvault.com/attacks-with-zip-files-and-mitigations/"
397     * @see "https://wiki.sei.cmu.edu/confluence/display/java/IDS04-J.+Safely+extract+files+from+ZipInputStream"
398     */
399    public static boolean isZIPSafe(String zipFilePath, int maxLevelDeepness, boolean rejectArchiveFile) {
400        List<String> archiveExtensions = Arrays.asList("zip", "tar", "7z", "gz", "jar", "phar", "bz2", "tgz");
401        boolean isSafe = false;
402        try {
403            File zipFile = new File(zipFilePath);
404            if (zipFile.exists() && zipFile.canRead() && zipFile.isFile() && maxLevelDeepness > 0) {
405                //Step 1: Try to load the file, if its fail then it imply that is not a valid ZIP file
406                try (ZipFile zipArch = new ZipFile(zipFile)) {
407                    //Step 2: Parse entries
408                    long deepness = 0;
409                    ZipEntry zipEntry;
410                    String entryExtension;
411                    String zipEntryName;
412                    boolean validationsFailed = false;
413                    Enumeration<? extends ZipEntry> entries = zipArch.entries();
414                    while (entries.hasMoreElements()) {
415                        zipEntry = entries.nextElement();
416                        zipEntryName = zipEntry.getName();
417                        entryExtension = zipEntryName.substring(zipEntryName.lastIndexOf(".") + 1).toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT).trim();
418                        //Step 2a: Check if the current entry is an archive file
419                        if (rejectArchiveFile && archiveExtensions.contains(entryExtension)) {
420                            validationsFailed = true;
421                            break;
422                        }
423                        //Step 2b: Check that level of deepness is inferior to the threshold specified
424                        if (zipEntryName.contains("/")) {
425                            //Determine deepness by inspecting the entry name.
426                            //Indeed, folder will be represented like this: folder/folder/folder/
427                            //So we can count the number of "/" to identify the deepness of the entry
428                            deepness = zipEntryName.chars().filter(ch -> ch == '/').count();
429                            if (deepness > maxLevelDeepness) {
430                                validationsFailed = true;
431                                break;
432                            }
433                        }
434                        //Step 2c: Check if any entries match pattern of zip slip payload
435                        if (zipEntryName.contains("..\\") || zipEntryName.contains("../")) {
436                            validationsFailed = true;
437                            break;
438                        }
439                    }
440                    if (!validationsFailed) {
441                        isSafe = true;
442                    }
443                }
444            }
445        } catch (Exception e) {
446            isSafe = false;
447        }
448        return isSafe;
449    }
450
451    /**
452     * Identify the mime type of the content specified (array of bytes).<br>
453     * Note that it cannot be fully trusted (see the tweet '1595824709186519041' referenced), so, additional validations are required.
454     *
455     * @param content The content as an array of bytes.
456     * @return The mime type in lower case or null if it cannot be identified.
457     * @see "https://twitter.com/righettod/status/1595824709186519041"
458     * @see "https://tika.apache.org/"
459     * @see "https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.apache.tika/tika-core"
460     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types"
461     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml"
462     */
463    public static String identifyMimeType(byte[] content) {
464        String mimeType = null;
465        if (content != null && content.length > 0) {
466            Detector detector = new DefaultDetector(MimeTypes.getDefaultMimeTypes());
467            Metadata metadata = new Metadata();
468            try {
469                try (TemporaryResources temporaryResources = new TemporaryResources(); TikaInputStream tikaInputStream = TikaInputStream.get(new ByteArrayInputStream(content), temporaryResources, metadata)) {
470                    MediaType mt = detector.detect(tikaInputStream, metadata);
471                    if (mt != null) {
472                        mimeType = mt.toString().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
473                    }
474                }
475            } catch (IOException ioe) {
476                mimeType = null;
477            }
478        }
479        return mimeType;
480    }
481
482    /**
483     * Apply a collection of validations on a string expected to be an public IP address:<br>
484     * - Is a valid IP v4 or v6 address.<br>
485     * - Is public from an Internet perspective.<br><br>
486     * <b>Note:</b> I often see missing such validation in the value read from HTTP request headers like "X-Forwarded-For" or "Forwarded".
487     * <br>
488     * <b>Note for IPv6:</b> I used documentation found so it is really experimental!
489     *
490     * @param ip String expected to be a valid IP address.
491     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
492     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/"
493     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-validator/apidocs/org/apache/commons/validator/routines/InetAddressValidator.html"
494     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html"
495     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_Orange_Tsai_Talk.pdf"
496     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/assets/Server_Side_Request_Forgery_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet_SSRF_Bible.pdf"
497     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/X-Forwarded-For"
498     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Forwarded"
499     * @see "https://ipcisco.com/lesson/ipv6-address/"
500     * @see "https://www.juniper.net/documentation/us/en/software/junos/interfaces-security-devices/topics/topic-map/security-interface-ipv4-ipv6-protocol.html"
501     * @see "https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/21/docs/api/java.base/java/net/InetAddress.html#getByName(java.lang.String)"
502     * @see "https://www.arin.net/reference/research/statistics/address_filters/"
503     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multicast_address"
504     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/5619409"
505     * @see "https://www.ripe.net/media/documents/ipv6-address-types.pdf"
506     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments/ipv6-unicast-address-assignments.xhtml"
507     * @see "https://developer.android.com/reference/java/net/Inet6Address"
508     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unique_local_address"
509     */
510    public static boolean isPublicIPAddress(String ip) {
511        boolean isValid = false;
512        try {
513            //Quick validation on the string itself based on characters used to compose an IP v4/v6 address
514            if (Pattern.matches("[0-9a-fA-F:.]+", ip)) {
515                //If OK then use the dedicated InetAddressValidator from Apache Commons Validator
516                if (InetAddressValidator.getInstance().isValid(ip)) {
517                    //If OK then validate that is an public IP address
518                    //From Javadoc for "InetAddress.getByName": If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
519                    InetAddress addr = InetAddress.getByName(ip);
520                    isValid = (!addr.isAnyLocalAddress() && !addr.isLinkLocalAddress()
521                            && !addr.isLoopbackAddress() && !addr.isMulticastAddress()
522                            && !addr.isSiteLocalAddress());
523                    //If OK and the IP is an V6 one then make additional validation because the built-in Java API will let pass some V6 IP
524                    //For the prefix map, the start of the key indicates if the value is a regex or a string
525                    if (isValid && (addr instanceof Inet6Address)) {
526                        Map<String, String> prefixes = new HashMap<>();
527                        prefixes.put("REGEX_LOOPBACK", "^(0|:)+1$");
528                        prefixes.put("REGEX_UNIQUE-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "^f(c|d)[a-f0-9]{2}:.*$");
529                        prefixes.put("STRING_LINK-LOCAL-ADDRESSES", "fe80:");
530                        prefixes.put("REGEX_TEREDO", "^2001:[0]*:.*$");
531                        prefixes.put("REGEX_BENCHMARKING", "^2001:[0]*2:.*$");
532                        prefixes.put("REGEX_ORCHID", "^2001:[0]*10:.*$");
533                        prefixes.put("STRING_DOCUMENTATION", "2001:db8:");
534                        prefixes.put("STRING_GLOBAL-UNICAST", "2000:");
535                        prefixes.put("REGEX_MULTICAST", "^ff[0-9]{2}:.*$");
536                        final List<Boolean> results = new ArrayList<>();
537                        final String ipLower = ip.trim().toLowerCase(Locale.ROOT);
538                        prefixes.forEach((addressType, expr) -> {
539                            String exprLower = expr.trim().toLowerCase();
540                            if (addressType.startsWith("STRING_")) {
541                                results.add(ipLower.startsWith(exprLower));
542                            } else {
543                                results.add(Pattern.matches(exprLower, ipLower));
544                            }
545                        });
546                        isValid = ((results.size() == prefixes.size()) && !results.contains(Boolean.TRUE));
547                    }
548                }
549            }
550        } catch (Exception e) {
551            isValid = false;
552        }
553        return isValid;
554    }
555
556    /**
557     * Compute a SHA256 hash from an input composed of a collection of strings.<br><br>
558     * This method take care to build the source string in a way to prevent this source string to be prone to abuse targeting the different parts composing it.<br><br>
559     * Example of possible abuse without precautions applied during the hash calculation logic:<br>
560     * Hash of <code>SHA256("Hello", "My", "World!!!")</code> will be equals to the hash of <code>SHA256("Hell", "oMyW", "orld!!!")</code>.<br><br>
561     * This method ensure that both hash above will be different.
562     *
563     * @param parts Ordered list of strings to use to build the input string for which the hash must be computed on. No null value is accepted on object composing the collection.
564     * @return The hash, as an array of bytes, to allow caller to convert it to the final representation wanted (HEX, Base64, etc.). If the collection passed is null or empty then the method return null.
565     * @throws Exception If any exception occurs
566     * @see "https://pentesterlab.com/badges/codereview"
567     */
568    public static byte[] computeHashNoProneToAbuseOnParts(List<String> parts) throws Exception {
569        byte[] hash = null;
570        if (parts != null && !parts.isEmpty()) {
571            //Ensure that not part is null
572            if (parts.stream().anyMatch(Objects::isNull)) {
573                throw new IllegalArgumentException("No part must be null!");
574            }
575            String separator = "|";
576            MessageDigest digest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA-256");
577            final StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(separator);
578            parts.forEach(p -> {
579                buffer.append(p).append(separator);
580            });
581            hash = digest.digest(buffer.toString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));
582        }
583        return hash;
584    }
585
586    /**
587     * Ensure that an XML file only uses DTD/XSD references (called System Identifier) present in the allowed list provided.<br><br>
588     * The code is based on the validation implemented into the OpenJDK 21, by the class <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java">java.util.prefs.XmlSupport</a></b>, in the method <b><a href="https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L240">loadPrefsDoc()</a></b>.<br><br>
589     * The method also ensure that no Public Identifier is used to prevent potential bypasses of the validations.
590     *
591     * @param xmlFilePath              Filename of the XML file to check.
592     * @param allowedSystemIdentifiers List of URL allowed for System Identifier specified for any XSD/DTD references.
593     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
594     * @see "https://www.w3schools.com/xml/prop_documenttype_systemid.asp"
595     * @see "https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/integration-bus/9.0.0?topic=doctypedecl-xml-systemid"
596     * @see "https://www.liquid-technologies.com/Reference/Glossary/XML_DocType.html"
597     * @see "https://www.xml.com/pub/98/08/xmlqna0.html"
598     * @see "https://github.com/openjdk/jdk/blob/jdk-21%2B35/src/java.prefs/share/classes/java/util/prefs/XmlSupport.java#L397"
599     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Formal_Public_Identifier"
600     */
601    public static boolean isXMLOnlyUseAllowedXSDorDTD(String xmlFilePath, final List<String> allowedSystemIdentifiers) {
602        boolean isSafe = false;
603        final String errorTemplate = "Non allowed %s ID detected!";
604        final String emptyFakeDTD = "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?><!ELEMENT dummy EMPTY>";
605        final String emptyFakeXSD = "<xs:schema xmlns:xs=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema\"> <xs:element name=\"dummy\"/></xs:schema>";
606
607        if (allowedSystemIdentifiers == null || allowedSystemIdentifiers.isEmpty()) {
608            throw new IllegalArgumentException("At least one SID must be specified!");
609        }
610        File xmlFile = new File(xmlFilePath);
611        if (xmlFile.exists() && xmlFile.canRead() && xmlFile.isFile()) {
612            try {
613                EntityResolver resolverValidator = (publicId, systemId) -> {
614                    if (publicId != null) {
615                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "PUBLIC"));
616                    }
617                    if (!allowedSystemIdentifiers.contains(systemId)) {
618                        throw new SAXException(String.format(errorTemplate, "SYSTEM"));
619                    }
620                    //If it is OK then return a empty DTD/XSD
621                    return new InputSource(new StringReader(systemId.toLowerCase().endsWith(".dtd") ? emptyFakeDTD : emptyFakeXSD));
622                };
623                DocumentBuilderFactory dbfInstance = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
624                dbfInstance.setIgnoringElementContentWhitespace(true);
625                dbfInstance.setXIncludeAware(false);
626                dbfInstance.setValidating(false);
627                dbfInstance.setCoalescing(true);
628                dbfInstance.setIgnoringComments(false);
629                DocumentBuilder builder = dbfInstance.newDocumentBuilder();
630                builder.setEntityResolver(resolverValidator);
631                Document doc = builder.parse(xmlFile);
632                isSafe = (doc != null);
633            } catch (SAXException | IOException | ParserConfigurationException e) {
634                isSafe = false;
635            }
636        }
637
638        return isSafe;
639    }
640
641    /**
642     * Apply a collection of validations on a EXCEL CSV file provided (file was expected to be opened in Microsoft EXCEL):<br>
643     * - Real CSV file.<br>
644     * - Do not contains any payload related to a CSV injections.<br><br>
645     * Ensure that, if Apache Commons CSV does not find any record then, the file will be considered as NOT safe (prevent potential bypasses).<br><br>
646     * <b>Note:</b> Record delimiter used is the <code>,</code> (comma) character. See the Apache Commons CSV reference provided for EXCEL.<br>
647     *
648     * @param csvFilePath Filename of the CSV file to check.
649     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
650     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/"
651     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/apidocs/org/apache/commons/csv/CSVFormat.html#EXCEL"
652     * @see "https://www.we45.com/post/your-excel-sheets-are-not-safe-heres-how-to-beat-csv-injection"
653     * @see "https://www.whiteoaksecurity.com/blog/2020-4-23-csv-injection-whats-the-risk/"
654     * @see "https://book.hacktricks.xyz/pentesting-web/formula-csv-doc-latex-ghostscript-injection"
655     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-community/attacks/CSV_Injection"
656     * @see "https://payatu.com/blog/csv-injection-basic-to-exploit/"
657     * @see "https://cwe.mitre.org/data/definitions/1236.html"
658     */
659    public static boolean isExcelCSVSafe(String csvFilePath) {
660        boolean isSafe;
661        final AtomicInteger recordCount = new AtomicInteger();
662        final List<Character> payloadDetectionCharacters = List.of('=', '+', '@', '-', '\r', '\t');
663
664        try {
665            final List<String> payloadsIdentified = new ArrayList<>();
666            try (Reader in = new FileReader(csvFilePath)) {
667                Iterable<CSVRecord> records = CSVFormat.EXCEL.parse(in);
668                records.forEach(record -> {
669                    record.forEach(recordValue -> {
670                        if (recordValue != null && !recordValue.trim().isEmpty() && payloadDetectionCharacters.contains(recordValue.trim().charAt(0))) {
671                            payloadsIdentified.add(recordValue);
672                        }
673                        recordCount.getAndIncrement();
674                    });
675                });
676            }
677            isSafe = (payloadsIdentified.isEmpty() && recordCount.get() > 0);
678        } catch (Exception e) {
679            isSafe = false;
680        }
681
682        return isSafe;
683    }
684
685    /**
686     * Provide a way to add an integrity marker (<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC">HMAC</a>) to a serialized object serialized using the <a href="https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization">java native system</a> (binary).<br>
687     * The goal is to provide <b>a temporary workaround</b> to try to prevent deserialization attacks and give time to move to a text-based serialization approach.
688     *
689     * @param processingMode Define the mode of processing i.e. protect or validate. ({@link eu.righettod.ProcessingMode})
690     * @param input          When the processing mode is "protect" than the expected input (string) is a java serialized object encoded in Base64 otherwise (processing mode is "validate") expected input is the output of this method when the "protect" mode was used.
691     * @param secret         Secret to use to compute the SHA256 HMAC.
692     * @return A map with the following keys: <ul><li><b>PROCESSING_MODE</b>: Processing mode used to compute the result.</li><li><b>STATUS</b>: A boolean indicating if the processing was successful or not.</li><li><b>RESULT</b>: Always contains a string representing the protected serialized object in the format <code>[SERIALIZED_OBJECT_BASE64_ENCODED]:[SERIALIZED_OBJECT_HMAC_BASE64_ENCODED]</code>.</li></ul>
693     * @throws Exception If any exception occurs.
694     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/Deserialization_Cheat_Sheet.html"
695     * @see "https://owasp.org/www-project-top-ten/2017/A8_2017-Insecure_Deserialization"
696     * @see "https://portswigger.net/web-security/deserialization"
697     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization-approaches"
698     * @see "https://www.baeldung.com/java-serialization"
699     * @see "https://cryptobook.nakov.com/mac-and-key-derivation/hmac-and-key-derivation"
700     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HMAC"
701     * @see "https://smattme.com/posts/how-to-generate-hmac-signature-in-java/"
702     */
703    public static Map<String, Object> ensureSerializedObjectIntegrity(ProcessingMode processingMode, String input, byte[] secret) throws Exception {
704        Map<String, Object> results;
705        String resultFormatTemplate = "%s:%s";
706        //Verify input provided to be consistent
707        if (processingMode == null) {
708            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The processing mode is mandatory!");
709        }
710        if (input == null || input.trim().isEmpty()) {
711            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input data is mandatory!");
712        }
713        if (secret == null || secret.length == 0) {
714            throw new IllegalArgumentException("The HMAC secret is mandatory!");
715        }
716        if (processingMode.equals(ProcessingMode.VALIDATE) && input.split(":").length != 2) {
717            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Input data provided is invalid for the processing mode specified!");
718        }
719        //Processing
720        Base64.Decoder b64Decoder = Base64.getDecoder();
721        Base64.Encoder b64Encoder = Base64.getEncoder();
722        String hmacAlgorithm = "HmacSHA256";
723        Mac mac = Mac.getInstance(hmacAlgorithm);
724        SecretKeySpec key = new SecretKeySpec(secret, hmacAlgorithm);
725        mac.init(key);
726        results = new HashMap<>();
727        results.put("PROCESSING_MODE", processingMode.toString());
728        switch (processingMode) {
729            case PROTECT -> {
730                byte[] objectBytes = b64Decoder.decode(input);
731                byte[] hmac = mac.doFinal(objectBytes);
732                String encodedHmac = b64Encoder.encodeToString(hmac);
733                results.put("STATUS", Boolean.TRUE);
734                results.put("RESULT", String.format(resultFormatTemplate, input, encodedHmac));
735            }
736            case VALIDATE -> {
737                String[] parts = input.split(":");
738                byte[] objectBytes = b64Decoder.decode(parts[0].trim());
739                byte[] hmacProvided = b64Decoder.decode(parts[1].trim());
740                byte[] hmacComputed = mac.doFinal(objectBytes);
741                String encodedHmacComputed = b64Encoder.encodeToString(hmacComputed);
742                Boolean hmacIsValid = Arrays.equals(hmacProvided, hmacComputed);
743                results.put("STATUS", hmacIsValid);
744                results.put("RESULT", String.format(resultFormatTemplate, parts[0].trim(), encodedHmacComputed));
745            }
746            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Not supported processing mode!");
747        }
748        return results;
749    }
750
751    /**
752     * Apply a collection of validations on a JSON string provided:<br>
753     * - Real JSON structure.<br>
754     * - Contain less than a specified number of deepness for nested objects or arrays.<br>
755     * - Contain less than a specified number of items in any arrays.<br><br>
756     *
757     * <b>Note:</b> I decided to use a parsing approach using only string processing to prevent any StackOverFlow or OutOfMemory error that can be abused.<br><br>
758     * I used the following assumption:
759     * <ul>
760     *      <li>The character <code>{</code> identify the beginning of an object.</li>
761     *      <li>The character <code>}</code> identify the end of an object.</li>
762     *      <li>The character <code>[</code> identify the beginning of an array.</li>
763     *      <li>The character <code>]</code> identify the end of an array.</li>
764     *      <li>The character <code>"</code> identify the delimiter of a string.</li>
765     *      <li>The character sequence <code>\"</code> identify the escaping of an double quote.</li>
766     * </ul>
767     *
768     * @param json                  String containing the JSON data to validate.
769     * @param maxItemsByArraysCount Maximum number of items allowed in an array.
770     * @param maxDeepnessAllowed    Maximum number nested objects or arrays allowed.
771     * @return True only if the string pass all validations.
772     * @see "https://javaee.github.io/jsonp/"
773     * @see "https://community.f5.com/discussions/technicalforum/disable-buffer-overflow-in-json-parameters/124306"
774     * @see "https://github.com/InductiveComputerScience/pbJson/issues/2"
775     */
776    public static boolean isJSONSafe(String json, int maxItemsByArraysCount, int maxDeepnessAllowed) {
777        boolean isSafe = false;
778
779        try {
780            //Step 1: Analyse the JSON string
781            int currentDeepness = 0;
782            int currentArrayItemsCount = 0;
783            int maxDeepnessReached = 0;
784            int maxArrayItemsCountReached = 0;
785            boolean currentlyInArray = false;
786            boolean currentlyInString = false;
787            int currentNestedArrayLevel = 0;
788            String jsonEscapedDoubleQuote = "\\\"";//Escaped double quote must not be considered as a string delimiter
789            String work = json.replace(jsonEscapedDoubleQuote, "'");
790            for (char c : work.toCharArray()) {
791                switch (c) {
792                    case '{': {
793                        if (!currentlyInString) {
794                            currentDeepness++;
795                        }
796                        break;
797                    }
798                    case '}': {
799                        if (!currentlyInString) {
800                            currentDeepness--;
801                        }
802                        break;
803                    }
804                    case '[': {
805                        if (!currentlyInString) {
806                            currentDeepness++;
807                            if (currentlyInArray) {
808                                currentNestedArrayLevel++;
809                            }
810                            currentlyInArray = true;
811                        }
812                        break;
813                    }
814                    case ']': {
815                        if (!currentlyInString) {
816                            currentDeepness--;
817                            currentArrayItemsCount = 0;
818                            if (currentNestedArrayLevel > 0) {
819                                currentNestedArrayLevel--;
820                            }
821                            if (currentNestedArrayLevel == 0) {
822                                currentlyInArray = false;
823                            }
824                        }
825                        break;
826                    }
827                    case '"': {
828                        currentlyInString = !currentlyInString;
829                        break;
830                    }
831                    case ',': {
832                        if (!currentlyInString && currentlyInArray) {
833                            currentArrayItemsCount++;
834                        }
835                        break;
836                    }
837                }
838                if (currentDeepness > maxDeepnessReached) {
839                    maxDeepnessReached = currentDeepness;
840                }
841                if (currentArrayItemsCount > maxArrayItemsCountReached) {
842                    maxArrayItemsCountReached = currentArrayItemsCount;
843                }
844            }
845            //Step 2: Apply validation against the value specified as limits
846            isSafe = ((maxItemsByArraysCount > maxArrayItemsCountReached) && (maxDeepnessAllowed > maxDeepnessReached));
847
848            //Step 3: If the content is safe then ensure that it is valid JSON structure using the "Java API for JSON Processing" (JSR 374) parser reference implementation.
849            if (isSafe) {
850                JsonReader reader = Json.createReader(new StringReader(json));
851                isSafe = (reader.read() != null);
852            }
853
854        } catch (Exception e) {
855            isSafe = false;
856        }
857        return isSafe;
858    }
859
860    /**
861     * Apply a collection of validations on a image file provided:<br>
862     * - Real image file.<br>
863     * - Its mime type is into the list of allowed mime types.<br>
864     * - Its metadata fields do not contains any characters related to a malicious payloads.<br>
865     *
866     * <br>
867     * <b>Important note:</b> This implementation is prone to bypass using the "<b>raw insertion</b>" method documented in the <a href="https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there">blog post</a> from the Synacktiv team.
868     * To handle such case, it is recommended to resize the image to remove any non image-related content, see <a href="https://github.com/righettod/document-upload-protection/blob/master/src/main/java/eu/righettod/poc/sanitizer/ImageDocumentSanitizerImpl.java#L54">here</a> for an example.<br>
869     *
870     * @param imageFilePath         Filename of the image file to check.
871     * @param imageAllowedMimeTypes List of image mime types allowed.
872     * @return True only if the file pass all validations.
873     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-imaging/"
874     * @see "https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-imaging/formatsupport.html"
875     * @see "https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types/Common_types"
876     * @see "https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml#image"
877     * @see "https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there"
878     * @see "https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/File_Upload_Cheat_Sheet.html"
879     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/document-upload-protection/blob/master/src/main/java/eu/righettod/poc/sanitizer/ImageDocumentSanitizerImpl.java"
880     * @see "https://exiftool.org/examples.html"
881     * @see "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_file_signatures"
882     * @see "https://hexed.it/"
883     * @see "https://github.com/sighook/pixload"
884     */
885    public static boolean isImageSafe(String imageFilePath, List<String> imageAllowedMimeTypes) {
886        boolean isSafe = false;
887        Pattern payloadDetectionRegex = Pattern.compile("[<>${}`]+", Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE);
888        try {
889            File imgFile = new File(imageFilePath);
890            if (imgFile.exists() && imgFile.canRead() && imgFile.isFile() && !imageAllowedMimeTypes.isEmpty()) {
891                final byte[] imgBytes = Files.readAllBytes(imgFile.toPath());
892                //Step 1: Check the mime type of the file against the allowed ones
893                ImageInfo imgInfo = Imaging.getImageInfo(imgBytes);
894                if (imageAllowedMimeTypes.contains(imgInfo.getMimeType())) {
895                    //Step 2: Load the image into an object using the Image API
896                    BufferedImage imgObject = Imaging.getBufferedImage(imgBytes);
897                    if (imgObject != null && imgObject.getWidth() > 0 && imgObject.getHeight() > 0) {
898                        //Step 3: Check the metadata if the image format support it - Highly experimental
899                        List<String> metadataWithPayloads = new ArrayList<>();
900                        final ImageMetadata imgMetadata = Imaging.getMetadata(imgBytes);
901                        if (imgMetadata != null) {
902                            imgMetadata.getItems().forEach(item -> {
903                                String metadata = item.toString();
904                                if (payloadDetectionRegex.matcher(metadata).find()) {
905                                    metadataWithPayloads.add(metadata);
906                                }
907                            });
908                        }
909                        isSafe = metadataWithPayloads.isEmpty();
910                    }
911                }
912            }
913        } catch (Exception e) {
914            isSafe = false;
915        }
916        return isSafe;
917    }
918
919    /**
920     * Rewrite the input file to remove any embedded files that is not embedded using a methods supported by the official format of the file.<br>
921     * Example: a file can be embedded by adding it at the end of the source file, see the reference provided for details.
922     *
923     * @param inputFilePath Filename of the file to clean up.
924     * @param inputFileType Type of the file provided.
925     * @return A array of bytes with the cleaned file.
926     * @throws IllegalArgumentException If an invalid parameter is passed
927     * @throws Exception                If any technical error during the cleaning processing
928     * @see "https://www.synacktiv.com/en/publications/persistent-php-payloads-in-pngs-how-to-inject-php-code-in-an-image-and-keep-it-there"
929     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/toolbox-pentest-web/tree/master/misc"
930     * @see "https://github.com/righettod/toolbox-pentest-web?tab=readme-ov-file#misc"
931     * @see "https://stackoverflow.com/a/13605411"
932     */
933    public static byte[] sanitizeFile(String inputFilePath, InputFileType inputFileType) throws Exception {
934        ByteArrayOutputStream sanitizedContent = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
935        File inputFile = new File(inputFilePath);
936        if (!inputFile.exists() || !inputFile.canRead() || !inputFile.isFile()) {
937            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot read the content of the input file!");
938        }
939        switch (inputFileType) {
940            case PDF -> {
941                try (PDDocument document = Loader.loadPDF(inputFile)) {
942                    document.save(sanitizedContent);
943                }
944            }
945            case IMAGE -> {
946                // Load the original image
947                BufferedImage originalImage = ImageIO.read(inputFile);
948                String originalFormat = identifyMimeType(Files.readAllBytes(inputFile.toPath())).split("/")[1].trim();
949                // Check that image has been successfully loaded
950                if (originalImage == null) {
951                    throw new IOException("Cannot load the original image !");
952                }
953                // Get current Width and Height of the image
954                int originalWidth = originalImage.getWidth(null);
955                int originalHeight = originalImage.getHeight(null);
956                // Resize the image by removing 1px on Width and Height
957                Image resizedImage = originalImage.getScaledInstance(originalWidth - 1, originalHeight - 1, Image.SCALE_SMOOTH);
958                // Resize the resized image by adding 1px on Width and Height - In fact set image to is initial size
959                Image initialSizedImage = resizedImage.getScaledInstance(originalWidth, originalHeight, Image.SCALE_SMOOTH);
960                // Save image to a bytes buffer
961                int bufferedImageType = BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB;//By default use a format supporting transparency
962                if ("jpeg".equalsIgnoreCase(originalFormat) || "bmp".equalsIgnoreCase(originalFormat)) {
963                    bufferedImageType = BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_RGB;
964                }
965                BufferedImage sanitizedImage = new BufferedImage(initialSizedImage.getWidth(null), initialSizedImage.getHeight(null), bufferedImageType);
966                Graphics2D drawer = sanitizedImage.createGraphics();
967                drawer.drawImage(initialSizedImage, 0, 0, null);
968                drawer.dispose();
969                ImageIO.write(sanitizedImage, originalFormat, sanitizedContent);
970            }
971            default -> throw new IllegalArgumentException("Type of file not supported !");
972        }
973        if (sanitizedContent.size() == 0) {
974            throw new IOException("An error occur during the rewrite operation!");
975        }
976        return sanitizedContent.toByteArray();
977    }
978}
